question:
In which of the following situations the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) declares Heat Wave?
  1. When for two consecutive days, the maximum temperature rises above 40 degree Celsius and is at least 4.5 degree above normal in plain areas
  2. When maximum temperature exceeds 45 degree Celsius over two days in plain areas
  3. When temperature is above 30 degree Celsius with departure of at least 4.5 degree Celsius in hilly regions
   Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation: In all of the above given conditions Indian Meteorlogical Department (IMD) declares the Heat Wave.
